On 18th\nSeptember, 1948, the news of Nizam's decision to surrender caused jubilation\nall over India and also among the people of Hyderabad.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Nizam surrendered\non 18 September 1948 and &nbsp;Mir Laik Ali,\nthe Prime Minister of the Nizam, and Razakar\u2019s \u201cField Marshall\u201d Qasim Rizvi\nwere arrested. &nbsp;The Nizam's surrender, is\ndubbed as the meekest and most cowardly in history. &nbsp;It is called by the west as \u201chappy war\u201d. &nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Nizam banned the\nRazakars and allowed Indian Union troops into Secunderabad and Bolurum. Credit\nfor this must go to Sardar Patel who held his nerve despite the hostile\nattitude of Pakistan and tacit support of Rothschild and Britain.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">While the Indian Army\nlost 19 men Hyderabad suffered much greater casualties in comparison. Over two\nthousand armed forces and Razakars were killed and thousands more injured.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Amongst the captured\ndefenders was a British mercenary who had been tasked with blowing up the\nbridge near Naldurg.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Military action\nnamed as Police action ended on 18 Sept 1948 when Arab Major General El edrus\nsurrendered at Secunderabad &nbsp;to Bengali Major\nGeneral J N Chaudhry of Indian armed forces . Contrary to Pakistani Muslim\nclaims the Indian army exercised total restraint. All know how the last Hindu\nKingdom of Vijayanagara was sacked with mindless looting and killing.&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Regaining the\nHindu&nbsp; foothold did NOT have much of\nbloodshed except for some retalioratory backlash killings.&nbsp; S Ankleswaria Aiyer the athieist Tamilian\n(&nbsp; Editor of Rothschild controlled The\nEconomic Times \u2013 and brother of <b><span style=\"color: blue;\">super-slimy</span></b> Mani Shankar Aiyer ) wrote a column\nin TOI that Hindus killed 2 lakh Muslims , which is sheer nonsense.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-tAZQXr_WEME/UgHKBtGjv_I/AAAAAAAAlEI/To05yj52Xqo/s1600/fegfwsg.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"320\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-tAZQXr_WEME/UgHKBtGjv_I/AAAAAAAAlEI/To05yj52Xqo/s320/fegfwsg.jpg\" width=\"240\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-7wOtWlEDI2A/UgHKFefiCQI/AAAAAAAAlEQ/oi3J75wGyao/s1600/images.jpg4t2wt.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-7wOtWlEDI2A/UgHKFefiCQI/AAAAAAAAlEQ/oi3J75wGyao/s1600/images.jpg4t2wt.jpg\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">We all know Rothschild\nwas against Operation Polo.&nbsp; Where are\nthe two lakh bodies-- disappeared like the 6 million Jews into thin air ?<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;Nehru, on proclaiming Indian victory in\nHyderabad, had announced that 'not a single communal incident' marred the\ntriumph-but this is hard to believe as the Indian Communists who aligned with\nthe Razakars before Operation Polo , turned coats &nbsp;and went of a Razakar killing frenzy &nbsp;.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When BJP leader LK Advani spoke about this\nunholy alliance between strange bed fellows Razakars and the Communists\nrecently , the CPM and CPI got terribly annoyed. &nbsp;An angry statement issued by the Communist\nParty of India in response to Advani's remark said: &nbsp;\"When the CPI along with the Andhra\nMahasabha organised people for liberating Hyderabad from the clutches of the\nNizam, Mr. Advani and the RSS were nowhere near Hyderabad.\"<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-szrusO0kbj8/UWhMJfIxhII/AAAAAAAAha0/1hoSAib4sNM/s1600/operation-polo-hyderabad-police-action-1948-photos+(33).jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"640\" src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-szrusO0kbj8/UWhMJfIxhII/AAAAAAAAha0/1hoSAib4sNM/s400/operation-polo-hyderabad-police-action-1948-photos+(33).jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n</div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"color: blue; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b>Above: Nizam's main army.</b></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">On September 23, 1948 the\nNizam was forced to withdraw his complaint from the UN Security Council. The\nmerger of Hyderabad into the Indian Union was announced. Major General\nChaudhuri took over as military governor of Hyderabad and stayed in that\nposition till the end of 1949. In January 1950, M. K. Vellodi, a senior civil\nservant was made the Chief Minister of the state and the Nizam was given the\nceremonial position of \"Raj Pramukh\" or \"Governor\".&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The\nRazakars were disbanded after the merger of Hyderabad with India and the\nMajlis-e-Ittehadul Muslimeen was banned. Qasim Rizvi served a decade in Indian\nprisons before being allowed to go to Pakistan where he was granted asylum.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Nizam escaped\npunishment under law and also became Rajpramukh ( Governor). He resigned after\nHyderabad was converted into AP state after merging some areas in Maharashtra\nand Karnataka.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-ExhJE5UDd14/UWhDwfb3iLI/AAAAAAAAhYU/ALO2c0C00fY/s1600/220px-NezamHaydarabad.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-ExhJE5UDd14/UWhDwfb3iLI/AAAAAAAAhYU/ALO2c0C00fY/s1600/220px-NezamHaydarabad.jpg\" /></a></div>\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Hyderabad state was\nnever independent under Muslim rule.. They were rulers on behalf of Mughal emperors\nand subsequently were protectorates of the English Governor Generals of East\nIndia Company and then of British Crown. While Most of the Indian states fought\nagainst the East India company in the 1857 war of independence, Afzaluddaula\nthe Nizam V remained loyal to the East India Company and was greatly rewarded. &nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Soon after his\naccession to the throne in 1911, the Nizam was warned by the then Viceroy Lord\nIrwin that he was 'on trial' ( probation ) for two years and at the end of\nwhich a Court of Regency could be set up replacing him.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Nizam had objected to\nhis 'installation' on the throne by the British Resident in 1911 unacceptable.\nHe claimed that he had come to the throne by divine right!! The British\nthreatened to replace him if he persisted. He was installed on the throne by\nthe British resident only.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Fifteen years later, he\ndisputed the right of The Paramount Power to interfere in the internal\nadministration of his state. Lord Reading, the then Viceroy, rebuked him : \u201cThe\nsovereignty of the British Crown is supreme ... no ruler of Indian states can\nclaim to negotiate with the British Government on equal footing.\u201d he said. The\nNizam was silenced.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Nizam \u2013 who traced\nhis ancestry to Abu Bakar \u2013 the first Khalifa \u2013 was a indeed complex\npersonality.&nbsp; &nbsp;Abu Bakr (Abdullah ibn Abi Quhafa)(&nbsp; 573 CE \u2013 23 August 634 CE)&nbsp; was a senior companion (Sahabi) and the\nfather-in-law of the Islamic prophet Muhammad. He ruled over the Rashidun\nCaliphate from 632\u2013634 CE when he became the first Muslim Caliph following\nMuhammad's death.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-_aWummLZ0XA/UWhKSQSxg_I/AAAAAAAAhaM/62Ru7KMCIJc/s1600/vdegw.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"315\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-_aWummLZ0XA/UWhKSQSxg_I/AAAAAAAAhaM/62Ru7KMCIJc/s400/vdegw.jpg\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Gandhi already was\nassassinated on 30 Jan 1948 and had Gandhi lived probably Hyderabad would have\nbeen allowed to remain as an independent state in the heart of Hyderabad and it\nwould have become a Darul Islam as dreamt by Aurangzeb. &nbsp;Hardly anybody knows today that not a single\nRussian bureaucrat signed the condolence book after Gandhi\u2019s &nbsp;death. &nbsp;Nobel\nprize for peace eluded him both in life and death. Shows Rothschild\u2019s regard\nfor this Mahatma ( sic!)<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In March 1952, the\nfirst popular general elections were held in the State and a Ministry under B.\nRamakrishna Rao was formed. With the formation of the first popular ministry,\nthe people of the Hyderabad State were also brought into the mainstream of\nIndia's national life.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-GPZyNmh7R8o/UWhLfxNOr7I/AAAAAAAAhak/t3H2SmJWoaE/s1600/operation-polo-hyderabad-police-action-1948-photos+(2).jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"640\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-GPZyNmh7R8o/UWhLfxNOr7I/AAAAAAAAhak/t3H2SmJWoaE/s400/operation-polo-hyderabad-police-action-1948-photos+(2).jpg\" width=\"505\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Nizam Mir Osman Ali\nKhan withdrew completely from public life and choose to lead a quiet, secluded\nlife with his family. He had wisely formed a number of trusts that took care of\nhis family's needs.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-6nVnsU__e6w/UcgsxWVGP-I/AAAAAAAAjfE/Ub6snF9btfs/s1600/c.1880's+PHOTO+INDIA+CHAR+MINAH+HYDRABAD+JOHNSTON+(1).jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"640\" src=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-6nVnsU__e6w/UcgsxWVGP-I/AAAAAAAAjfE/Ub6snF9btfs/s400/c.1880's+PHOTO+INDIA+CHAR+MINAH+HYDRABAD+JOHNSTON+(1).jpg\" width=\"504\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"color: red; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Above : Photo of Charminar in 1880.</i></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The last Nizam of Hyderabad,\nMir Osman Ali Khan, died in 1967 putting an end to a princely heritage of\nunimaginable wealth, exemplary public administration and a unique Deccani\nculture. The last of his (stolen from Hampi ) treasures were purchased by the\nIndian Government in 1995. Some of it is on display in museums in Hyderabad and\nthe rest is still locked up safely in the vaults of the Reserve Bank of India. &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A legend about the first Nizam states that, on\none of his hunting trips he was offered some kulcha (an Indian bread) by a\nHindu saint and was asked to eat as many as he could. The Nizam could eat seven\nkulchas and the holy man then prophesied that seven generations of his family\nwould rule the state.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Nizam's were conferred with the title of His Exalted\nHighness, and \"Faithful Ally of the British Government\" by the\nimperial-colonial British government for their collaborating r\u00f4le in the wars\nagainst Tipoo Sultan of Mysore, and the &nbsp;Sepoy\u2019s mutiny of 1857. All the Muslims of\nIndia had declared war against the British in 1857.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Today not a single\nprincely state remains independent. They, all five hundred and sixty-five of\nthem, were merged into the Republic under the masterful and rather persuasive\nsupervision of Sardar Vallabhai Patel. Some of these states did not go down\nwithout a fight however. Travancore, Jodhpur and Indore signed up after\nprotracted political wrangling. Conflict situation arose in both Junagadh and\nKashmir. The later continues to have repercussions in modern Indian politics.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-RTxv7WnJvIM/Uc7Unvi-JbI/AAAAAAAAjmk/SYJCOOxUV_s/s640/Indian+Prime+Minister+Jawaharlal+Nehru+and+his+sister+Vijaya+Lakshmi+Pandit+during+visit+to+annexed+Hyderabad+-+1949.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"640\" src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-RTxv7WnJvIM/Uc7Unvi-JbI/AAAAAAAAjmk/SYJCOOxUV_s/s400/Indian+Prime+Minister+Jawaharlal+Nehru+and+his+sister+Vijaya+Lakshmi+Pandit+during+visit+to+annexed+Hyderabad+-+1949.jpg\" width=\"499\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: red; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b><i>Above: Nehru and Vijaya Lakshmi Pandit on arrival Hyderbad after liberation.</i></b></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Qasim Razvi was born in\na middle-class family of Latur (now in Maharashtra) on 31st May, 1900. He did\nhis graduation in law from the Aligarh Muslim University. When Bahadur Yar Jung\nappealed to the Muslims for funds, he donated all his properties to Majlis. &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">He even went to his own house and started\nthrowing out the furniture to make it a paty office. Bahadur Yar Jung himself\ngave him the title of \"Siddiq-e-Deccan\" for this act. &nbsp;By donating whatever he owned, he emulated the\nfirst caliph of Islam Hazrath Abu Bakar Siddiq who donated everything for Islam.\n<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Primarily, the\nHyderabad lobby comprising of Nawabs, Jagirdars, senior officials in Nizam's\ngovernment and others were not happy with Qasim Razvi getting elected as the\nPresident of a powerful organization \u2013 Majlis-e-Ittehadul Muslimeen, after a\nsuspicious death of the previous Presdient , and they all hated him inwardly.\nHe fell apart with the Nizam when he could NOT be controlled or harnessed. &nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-jr-qtepMric/UWhINeelk1I/AAAAAAAAhZo/f4cFXYGme0s/s1600/operation-polo-hyderabad-police-action-1948-photos+%2528114%2529.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"427\" src=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-jr-qtepMric/UWhINeelk1I/AAAAAAAAhZo/f4cFXYGme0s/s400/operation-polo-hyderabad-police-action-1948-photos+%2528114%2529.jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n</div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">According to Gen.Chowdhary, Qasim Razvi was\nstaying at a relative's house. When the Indian Army officials went to arrest\nhim, he threatened that he would commit suicide, unlike a uniformed Field Marshall.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Both Nizam and Qasim\nRazvi failed to realise that they were not enjoying the support of the entire\nMuslim community. They were also unaware of of the military might of the Indian\nUnion and their own strengths.&nbsp; The Arab commander-in-chief\nAl-Idroos covertly supported the Indian Union and ensured that the 'Operation\nPolo' succeeded.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Qasim Razvi was an unimpressive frail chain smoking man, but his eyes flashed fire. &nbsp;Qasim Razvi was a terrific orator, but he had\nno control over words. &nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">His hate speeches\n&nbsp;pissed off the Hindu population. &nbsp;&nbsp;Probably\nthis was what Akbaruddin Owaisi unconsciously adopted, that is if he knew the unique\npersonality of Qasim Razvi.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-mmU-pGCNkmw/UWhKKRTkmfI/AAAAAAAAhaE/PQaB2FDQ1-o/s1600/operation-polo-hyderabad-police-action-1948-photos+(11).jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"640\" src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-mmU-pGCNkmw/UWhKKRTkmfI/AAAAAAAAhaE/PQaB2FDQ1-o/s400/operation-polo-hyderabad-police-action-1948-photos+(11).jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Power drunk Qasim Razi\nforced his own decisions on the poor Nizam i.e. who should be the President of\nthe Executive Council of Hyderabad Government or who should be made the members\nof the Executive Council, etc. &nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Nizam\u2019s knew for\nsure that his army and police were afraid of the Razakars , who outnumbered\nthem and would NOT hesitate to hold their families hostage..</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n</div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; line-height: 150%; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-ab0DDlXEwgM/UWhLzpLXOkI/AAAAAAAAhas/s0Z9x7skBbQ/s1600/operation-polo-hyderabad-police-action-1948-photos+(101).jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"640\" src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-ab0DDlXEwgM/UWhLzpLXOkI/AAAAAAAAhas/s0Z9x7skBbQ/s400/operation-polo-hyderabad-police-action-1948-photos+(101).jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;;\"><span style=\"font-size: small;\"><span style=\"line-height: 150%;\">He had\nindeed&nbsp; become a Frankenstein. &nbsp;Paranoid Nizam trusted no one and had a very\neffective espionage system \u2013 spying even on his own sons, cant blame him--he had so many of them. &nbsp;In the invader&nbsp;</span></span><span style=\"line-height: 24px;\">Muslim</span><span style=\"font-size: small;\"><span style=\"line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;tradition sons killed their royal fathers , and fathers blinded their own sons in gory- nay macabre power games..<o:p></o:p></span></span></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;;\"><span style=\"font-size: small;\"><span style=\"line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></span></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-KP4VMEBfBlw/UWmVxaZxh2I/AAAAAAAAhcc/Ngj3f3SiHQQ/s1600/6a00d8341c562c53ef014e8b0c24ea970d-320wi.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"400\" src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-KP4VMEBfBlw/UWmVxaZxh2I/AAAAAAAAhcc/Ngj3f3SiHQQ/s400/6a00d8341c562c53ef014e8b0c24ea970d-320wi.jpg\" width=\"327\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;;\"><span style=\"font-size: small;\"><span style=\"line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></span></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;;\"><span style=\"font-size: small;\"><span style=\"color: red; line-height: 150%;\"><b>Above: Mir Laik Ali and wife -- bribed their way out .</b></span></span></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;;\"><span style=\"font-size: small;\"><span style=\"line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></span></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;;\"><span style=\"font-size: small;\"><span style=\"color: magenta; line-height: 150%;\"><b>Let me digress--&nbsp;</b></span></span></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;;\"><span style=\"font-size: small;\"><span style=\"color: magenta; line-height: 150%;\"><b><br /></b></span></span></span><span style=\"color: magenta;\"><b><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;;\"><span style=\"font-size: small;\"><span style=\"line-height: 150%;\">How did PM Mir Laik Ali escaped from house arrest in 1950, after 18 months of captivity?</span></span></span></b></span><br />\n<span style=\"color: magenta;\"><b><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;;\"><span style=\"font-size: small;\"><span style=\"line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></span></span></b></span>\n<span style=\"color: magenta;\"><b><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">It must be remembered\nthat he was responsible for ethnic cleansing along with Qasim Ravi. &nbsp;&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">He was appointed as</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp; </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">PM on 1st December 1947.&nbsp;</span></b></span><br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: magenta;\"><b><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">After the Police\nAction, in &nbsp;September 1948, he was put\nunder house arrest at Begumpet , where Amruta Mall now stands.&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">The police guards\nallowed </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Laik Ali\u2019s family to visit him\ndaily.&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Muslim ladies ,\nincluding his wife used to come by car in burqa.&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">In course of time the\nsecurity became lax ( by bribing ) .</span></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: magenta;\"><b><br /></b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: magenta;\"><b>One day Mrs. Laik Ali suddenly\nannounced that her husband is ill. &nbsp;From\nthen on Laik Ali pretended to be ill,though he had no fever.<o:p></o:p></b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: magenta;\"><b><br /></b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: magenta;\"><b>His wife started making\nfrantic trips to consult his physician and to bring medicines. &nbsp;This drama went on for a full two weeks,\nwithout anybody making inquiries about this important Pakistani detainee.<o:p></o:p></b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: magenta;\"><b><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Meanwhile it was\nannounced that a marriage was about to be celebrated in the house of one of the\nrelatives of Laik Ali. &nbsp; A lorry came and\ncarried utensils and other things from the house.&nbsp;</span></b></span><br />\n<span style=\"color: magenta;\"><b><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></b></span>\n<span style=\"color: magenta;\"><b><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Dancers &nbsp;started coming daily and performing mujra dance.\n&nbsp;They were given tips on behalf of Laik\nAli and often some sweets were also distributed. &nbsp;These dancers ( whores ) flirted with the\nguards and made them lower their guard.</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: magenta;\"><b>On the morning of 3rd\nMarch 1950 the maid called for the car saying that the Begum was ready to go\nthe doctor. &nbsp;When the car pulled in under\nthe portico, Laik Ali quietly walked in in a burqa. &nbsp;The unsuspecting guards were on the other\nside. &nbsp;Some pillows had been so arranged\nin his bed as to give the impression that the patient was lying under the\nsheet. &nbsp;</b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: magenta;\"><b><br /></b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: magenta;\"><b>Mrs. Laik Ali hid herself in the\nupper portion of the house. &nbsp;Laik Ali\ndrove straight to his sister\u2019s house. &nbsp;From\nthere, he drove away to the house of Abdul Quvi I another car. The original car\nthen returned to the house and the maid casually announced that her mistress\nhad come back with medicines. &nbsp;Mrs. Laik\nAli then emerged from her hiding place and went to her husband\u2019s bedroom. &nbsp;</b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: magenta;\"><b><br /></b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: magenta;\"><b>She addressed the covered pillows and told\nthem that the physician had changed the medicines. &nbsp;She then pretended to administer the medicine\nto the patient. &nbsp;All stage managed , with\nthe female detective unpeturbed.<o:p></o:p></b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: magenta;\"><b><br /></b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: magenta;\"><b><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A taxi with curtains\nwas waiting at the residence of Abdul Quvi. &nbsp;Laik Ali and his sister\u2019s son joined him and\nthe threesome drove towards Gulbarga.&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">A four-berth first class\ncompartment had been booked in the train at Secunderabad with instructions that\nthe passengers would board at Gulbarga. </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Though there were only 3 people in the\ncompartment, the entire bogie was reserved.</span></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: magenta;\"><b><br /></b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: magenta;\"><b>The train took them to\nBombay early in the morning. &nbsp;After bath\nand breakfast, they left for the airport. Laik Ali flew in disquise under the\nname of Gulam Ahmed, all forged papers arranged by Pakistan secret services.<o:p></o:p></b></span></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: magenta;\"><b><br /></b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: magenta;\"><b>Back in Hyderabad, for\ntwo days the charade was kept up. &nbsp;Mrs.\nLaik Ali kept on administering medicines to the pillows. &nbsp;<o:p></o:p></b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: magenta;\"><b><br /></b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: magenta;\"><b>Groups of Holi\nrevellers came and were given tips on behalf of the \u2018ailing\u2019 ex-premier. &nbsp;On the next day, Mrs. Laik Ali made a number\nof neat bundles of currency notes-- a large amount. &nbsp;She\ngave them to her old trust Arab servant with instructions that they should be\ndisbursed to the named servants on Sunday. &nbsp;She then drove to her brother\u2019s house. &nbsp;</b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: magenta;\"><b><br /></b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: magenta;\"><b>From there she went to the airport in a purdah\ncar to catch the flight o Bombay. &nbsp;Just\nshort of the airport, the car broke down. The driver got down to pushes it.\nFrom behind came the car of the Inspector General of Police, Jetley. &nbsp;Noticing a purdah car stalled, the chivalrous\npolice chief got down to give it a push!<o:p></o:p></b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: magenta;\"><b><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">As Laik Ali boarded the\nflight to Karachi, his family took the ship \u2018S.S.Sabarmati\u2019 to Karachi.&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Laik Ali could not be extradited.&nbsp;</span></b></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When the Nizam went to\nthe radio station to announce his surrender , there was no red carpet spread for\nhim, &nbsp;no formalities were observed. &nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">No\nmusic, no anthem was played before or after the broadcast. &nbsp;The speech was in\nEnglish. &nbsp;Nobody cared to translate it into the official language Urdu.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">As soon a Nizam\nannounced his surrender to Operation Polo on the radio, that minute onwards\nthere was a bloody genocide in the Andhra.&nbsp;\n&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The opportunist\nCommunists had supported Jew Rothschild ( Britain ) in the 1942 Quit India\nmovement. From 1942 to 1948 , the Communists supported the Crypto Jew Nizam of\nHyderabad and the Razakars. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">They tuned coat and\nstarted killing landlords and their entire families. The local registry offices\nwere burnt to destroy any vestige of land records. The communist leaders\nusurped the land. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">You can trace back\nthese communist leader peasants who suddenly became rich landowners in 1948. &nbsp;Today they are all huge landowners, with NO\nclass . <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n</span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Most of the Muslim\nlandowners who survived escaped to Karanataka . This was just a repeat of what\nhappened in Pakistan to the Hindu landowners.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-HQyBY3jdi0Y/UWhClOCISnI/AAAAAAAAhYE/ElBtKJVndNw/s1600/operation-polo-hyderabad-police-action-1948-photos+(123).jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"640\" src=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-HQyBY3jdi0Y/UWhClOCISnI/AAAAAAAAhYE/ElBtKJVndNw/s400/operation-polo-hyderabad-police-action-1948-photos+(123).jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">After the radio broadcast of\nsurrender the Nizam drove back to King Kothi to brood and sulk. &nbsp;KM Munshi on his way to Bolarum found the\nstreets full of excited crowds shouting fervent national slogans. &nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Munshi was mobbed and had to address groups\nof people en route. They wanted to be re-assured by India's official representative\nthat they were now again part of the great motherland--the most glorious and ancient civilization on the planet..&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-4zwY9wtN7A4/UWhJviTN6tI/AAAAAAAAhZ8/lbkH1_dE3Rs/s1600/operation-polo-hyderabad-police-action-1948-photos+(16).jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"400\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-4zwY9wtN7A4/UWhJviTN6tI/AAAAAAAAhZ8/lbkH1_dE3Rs/s400/operation-polo-hyderabad-police-action-1948-photos+(16).jpg\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">That night the\ncity changed a great deal. Many khaki uniforms were discarded, many beards\nshaved. The shouting, rampaging crowds of razakars melted away magically. The long oppressed citizens emerged from their cocoons.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">People of all ages came out in throngs\nwaving the tricolour of India. Suddenly where there was fear and restraint, now\nthere was life and laughter. There was a general release of tension and a new,\nquivering anticipation.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The surrender ceremony\nwas fixed at 4 p.m.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">General Choudhuri spoke\ngravely: &nbsp;<b><span style=\"color: blue;\">\u201c<i>I have been ordered by Lt. General Maharaj Rajendresinhji, General\nOfficer Commanding-in-Chief, Southern Command to take the surrender of your\narmy</i>\u201d.<o:p></o:p></span></b></span><br />\n<span style=\"color: blue; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b><br /></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: blue; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b>\u201c<i>You have it\u201d.<o:p></o:p></i></b></span><br />\n<span style=\"color: blue; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><b><br /></b></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: blue; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><b>\u201cYou understand that\nthis surrender is unconditional\u201d.<o:p></o:p></b></i></span><br />\n<span style=\"color: blue; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><b><br /></b></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><b><span style=\"color: blue;\">\u201cYes, I understand\u201d.</span></b></i><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n</div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><br /></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; line-height: 150%; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-ngbKxq7TTHY/UWhCTs_W4WI/AAAAAAAAhX8/VNoDrW4HrzQ/s1600/operation-polo-hyderabad-police-action-1948-photos+(79).jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"640\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-ngbKxq7TTHY/UWhCTs_W4WI/AAAAAAAAhX8/VNoDrW4HrzQ/s400/operation-polo-hyderabad-police-action-1948-photos+(79).jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Gen Choudhuri smiled and shook\nhands with the Arab general Edroos. Then he opened his cigarette case and\noffered him a cigarette. Edroos pro ffered a lighter. Choudhuri's team joined\nthem.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The party drove to the\nresidence of India's Agent General. A jubilant crowd cheered the victorious general\nthere. He waved in return and then sat down to discuss the details with Munshi,\n&nbsp;Edroos and others.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-PWvmiBnkhP4/UWhBTo4aTiI/AAAAAAAAhX0/vPK_jT3sVcA/s1600/operation-polo-hyderabad-police-action-1948-photos+(17).jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"640\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-PWvmiBnkhP4/UWhBTo4aTiI/AAAAAAAAhX0/vPK_jT3sVcA/s400/operation-polo-hyderabad-police-action-1948-photos+(17).jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">It was a astonishing sea\nof cheering humanity, heads, heads, heads, bare and covered. &nbsp;Men and women, ten deep, twenty deep, grinning children\non shoulders, on heads of adults, young people perched on the railings, on\ntree-tops, even dangling on telephone poles. <o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-GR44-Si2GXw/UWi2OpQiR8I/AAAAAAAAhbs/XZswQt0w9_I/s1600/downloadsbeh64u.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"320\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-GR44-Si2GXw/UWi2OpQiR8I/AAAAAAAAhbs/XZswQt0w9_I/s320/downloadsbeh64u.jpg\" width=\"296\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">It was a riot of glad colours, dresses of all types in all the colours of rainbow, only deeper, like\na field of flowers of different hues. &nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">And then tricolours, thousands of them,\neach hand holding one, even two, green, white and ochre, fluttering joyously. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Flags made of cloth,\nand of paper quivered gaily in the gentle breeze. They reflected the joy of the hands\nholding them. There was clapping and wild cheering, shouting , giggling and some shrieking their happy heads off..\n<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-Z-lKfl8WgCg/UWhBLbxMgNI/AAAAAAAAhXs/ymx77Y8A764/s1600/operation-polo-hyderabad-police-action-1948-photos+(15).jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; Throngs of\npeople shouting slogans, which could not be uttered under pain of death, &nbsp;till the previous day for centuries. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">Above: &nbsp;142 &nbsp;year old picture, taken in 1870 &nbsp;. You can see the horse carriage of the photographer .</span></i></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"color: red; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<span style=\"color: red; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<span style=\"color: red; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"></span><br />\n<ol id=\"top-ra\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; list-style-type: none; padding: 0px;\">\n<li class=\"comment\" id=\"c841066437110554632\" style=\"border-bottom: 0px; margin: 0px 0px 16px; padding: 0.25em 0px 0px;\"><div class=\"avatar-image-container\" style=\"float: left; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px; margin: 0.2em 0px 0px; max-height: 36px; overflow: hidden; width: 36px;\">\n<img alt=\"\" src=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-QSnd-Z8F7Kc/XFtPudWdwlI/AAAAAAABfq4/vxrkFOO7Iu8Mf6-OaPgw6FPpRDSmMgLdgCK4BGAYYCw/s35/capt%25252BajitC%25252Bvadakayil.JPG\" style=\"border: 1px solid rgb(238, 238, 238); max-width: 36px;\" /></div>\n<div class=\"comment-block\" style=\"margin-left: 48px; position: relative;\">\n<div class=\"comment-header\" style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px; margin: 0px 0px 8px;\">\n<cite class=\"user\" style=\"font-style: normal; font-weight: bold;\"><a href=\"https://www.blogger.com/profile/14410812789424637654\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration-line: none;\">Capt. Ajit Vadakayil</a></cite><span class=\"icon user blog-author\" style=\"background-image: url(&quot;data:image/png; background-repeat: no-repeat; display: inline-block; font-weight: bold; height: 18px; margin: 0px 0px -4px 6px; width: 18px;\"></span><span class=\"datetime secondary-text\" style=\"margin-left: 6px;\"><a href=\"https://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2019/02/sanatana-dharma-hinduism-exhumed-and_23.html?showComment=1550991677384#c841066437110554632\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration-line: none;\">February 24, 2019 at 12:31 PM</a></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-content\" style=\"margin-bottom: 8px; text-align: justify;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">WE ASK THE MODI GOVT TO UNDERSTAND TRU HISTORY OF KASHMIR\u2014NOT FAKE HISTORY WRITTEN BY ROTHSCHILD HISTORIANS..</span><br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">The state of Jammu and Kashmir originally had five parts to it: Jammu, Kashmir, Ladakh, Aksai Chin and Northern Areas (Gilgit-Baltistan).</span><br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">Over time, India has lost Aksai Chin to China and, of course, the part captured by the tribal raiders in October 1947, which Pakistan chooses to refer to as \u201cAzad\u201d Kashmir, which incidentally includes the Gilgit-Baltistan area garnered courtesy a quietly executed Rotshchild coup.</span><br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">In July 1948 , 24 year old Major William Alexander Brown was awarded the MBE (Military) by JEW Rothschild and it surprised everybody. The real reason is that he ensured the Gilgit went to Pakistan, not India as per Rothschild\u2019s orders..&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif;\">\n<span style=\"color: blue; font-size: large;\">Rothschild needed an Islamic buffer in that area . Islam and Communism are like oil and water \u2013 can commingle\u2014but never mix..</span></div>\n<div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\"><br /></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">JEW William Alexander Brown fluent in Pashtun language , was the son of Rothschild\u2019s agent William Neilson Brown, who was awarded the Military Cross during WW1. His grandfather, Alexander Laing Brown, was a Liberal MP .&nbsp;</span><br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">The Brown family were part of the Opium network of Rothschild under the front of wood traders.</span><br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">On 29 July 1947 24 year old Major William Alexander Brown , witnessed the formal handover of Gilgit on 1 August, when the British flag was lowered and that of Jammu &amp; Kashmir raised in its place.</span><br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">Brigadier Ghansara Singh was the representative of the Maharaja of Jammu &amp; Kashmir.</span><br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">On August 1, 1947 the Gilgit lease was receded by Delhi to the maharaja of J&amp;K and Lt. Col. Roger Bacon, the British political agent, handed over the area to Brig. Ghansara Singh, the state\u2019s new governor.</span><br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">The British officers of Gilgit Scouts: Major William Alexander Brown and Capt. A.S. Mathieson, still served Hari Singh as contract officers, though they continued to receive instructions from the political agent for Khyber based in Peshawar which was now Pakistan.</span><br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">Brown and Mathieson had to swear an oath of allegiance to the maharaja on the \u201choly book\u201d Bible. These two wrapped an Oxford dictionary in red cloth and made an ass out of the Maharaja.</span><br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">As soon as Maharaja Hari Singh acceded to India, Brown got the Gilgit Scouts to surround the residency and, after a short gun battle, he imprisoned governor Ghansara Singh. Brown then informed Peshawar about the accession of Gilgit to Pakistan.&nbsp;</span><br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">On November 2, the major raised the Pakistani flag at his headquarters and informed the force that they now served the government in Karachi. Brown and Mathieson had surreptitiously opted for service in Pakistan when the maharaja signed the Instrument of Accession in favour of India. Since Gilgit by this act had become a part of India, properly, they should have made an immediate request for release from their appointments. But they didn\u2019t.</span><br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">The geopolitically sensitive Gilgit had been swallowed whole by two Brits acting in concert with Pakistan. India was aghast.</span><br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">Maj Brown was instructed by Jew Rothschild that the Muslim majority areas of Gilgit, Baltistan, Hunza, Nagar and Chitral, should join Pakistan.</span><br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">Throughout the Kashmir War (October 22, 1947 to January 1, 1949), Rothschild successfully ensured that Pakistan\u2019s occupation of this region was not disturbed.</span><br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">JEW Maj Brown and his associate, Subedar-Major JEW Babar Khan, realised that Gilgit would be surrounded and attacked by other rulers of Northern Areas and the Gilgit Scouts would defy orders if asked to take up arms..</span><br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">On November 1, 1947, Maj Brown arbitrarily declared that the Hindu rule had come to an end and added that Gilgit and the adjoining areas would join Pakistan</span><br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">After Mountbatten\u2019s mediatory role and the collapse of the direct talks between Jawaharlal Nehru and Liaquat Ali Khan, the Indian Cabinet planned a full-scale war.&nbsp;</span><br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">CONTINUED TO 2--</span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-replies\" style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; margin-left: 36px; Ajit Vadakayil</a></cite><span class=\"icon user blog-author\" style=\"background-image: url(&quot;data:image/png; background-repeat: no-repeat; display: inline-block; font-weight: bold; height: 18px; margin: 0px 0px -4px 6px; width: 18px;\"></span><span class=\"datetime secondary-text\" style=\"margin-left: 6px;\"><a href=\"https://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2019/02/sanatana-dharma-hinduism-exhumed-and_23.html?showComment=1550991732835#c6106897274004080364\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration-line: none;\">February 24, 2019 at 12:32 PM</a></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-content\" style=\"margin-bottom: 8px; text-align: justify;\">\nCONTINUED FROM 1--</div>\n<div>\n<span style=\"color: red; font-size: large;\">But Mountbatten used his wife JEWESS Edwina ( of Rothschild blood ) to convince Nehru during pillow talk , that \u201cthe UN would promptly direct Pakistan to withdraw the raiders, which would make war unnecessary.\u201d&nbsp; &nbsp;And Nehru believed her, internationalising Kashmir in the process.&nbsp;</span><b style=\"color: red; font-size: x-large;\">Thus, Gilgit was lost forever</b><span style=\"color: red; font-size: large;\">.</span></div>\n<br />\nIn Calcutta William Alexander Brown had been ambushed by angry Sikhs for his pro- Muslim attitude ( read as pro- Pakistani kosher deep state ) and left for dead in the street . Miraculously he was found by a doctor and he recovered.<br />\n<br />\nIn 1957 JEW William Brown met JEWESS Margaret Rosemary Cooksley, who was serving with the UK High Commission in Karachi.<br />\n<br />\nOn 5 December 1984 , William Brown died in Britain .<br />\n<br />\n<div>\n<span style=\"color: purple; font-size: large;\">On Independence Day 1993, of the medal Sitara-i-Pakistan was issued as a posthumous recognition by Pakistan President Farooq Leghari of his great contribution. His widow Margaret received the medal in Islamabad from the hands of President Leghari on Pakistan Day, 23 March 1994.</span></div>\n<br />\n<span style=\"color: red; font-size: 16px;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2013/01/the-kashmir-conflict-capt-ajit-vadakayil.html</span><br />\n<br />\nROTHSCHILD WANTED JEW NIZAM OF HYDERABAD TO ACCEDE TO PAKISTAN \u2013 THIS WAS STOPPED BY PATEL.<br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"color: red;
