text-align: center;\">\n</div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n</div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Arjuna tree is\nmentioned in the Rig Veda of 5000 BC. &nbsp;(It\nhas nothing to do with Arjuna of Mahabharata) . (R.V.1/122/5). &nbsp;&nbsp;Hindu\nmythology documented that this tree has its origin when lord Indra killed a demon\nby name Vritra.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Arjuna tree is\nabout 25 metres tall and forms a wide canopy . It has a life span of more than &nbsp;600 years.&nbsp;\nIt blooms pale yellow flowers between March and June.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">It has 4 cm fibrous\nwoody fruit, divided into five wings, appears between September and November. &nbsp;The Antheraea paphia moth likes to feed on its\nleaves which produces the tassar silk .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">It is easy to identify\nwith its outer &nbsp;grey bark stiff &nbsp;flaking off in pieces. &nbsp;Inner bark is &nbsp;thick flesh colored when cut, &nbsp;exuding red resin. &nbsp;&nbsp;Arjun\nyields up to 50 kg dry bark chips on a three year cycle without damaging the tree.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-WMKeUSdHgk4/UVA-aJVRe4I/AAAAAAAAg8A/zIgS8nFGKb8/s1600/imagesffrb.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"250\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-WMKeUSdHgk4/UVA-aJVRe4I/AAAAAAAAg8A/zIgS8nFGKb8/s400/imagesffrb.jpg\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The bark of the tree is\nused in Ayurvedic medicines. The bark contains usually a large quantity of tannin\nand calcium. It also contains good quantities of aluminum, sodium, magnesium,\nzinc and copper. &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Arjun Bark decoction prevents\nbuild up deposits , and also dissolves the existing deposits in the arteries. &nbsp;Hence it reverses hardening of the arteries. &nbsp;It had blood lipid lowering activity and thins\nthe blood. &nbsp;It is good for&nbsp; alleviating \u201chritshool\u201d (angina) and helps\nmaintain cholesterol levels due to lipid lowering effects. The bark enhances\nheart muscle tone and prevents heart palpitations.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The bark is used to\nprevent liver cirrhosis and liver enlargement.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The bark is used to\ntreat STD and gonorrhoea . It is used for treatment of wounds, ulcers, scorpion\nbites and bleeding piles , applied topically.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">It is useful for &nbsp;abdominal disorders such as diarrhea<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">It pulverizes the calculi\nstones in urinary tract and kidneys and flushed it out. It is good for bile\nduct disorders.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The bark is used to\nprevent early ejaculation and impotence .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">It prevents\naccumulation of fluids, thereby reduces edema.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-RB4gloq2pO4/UVCVCh8fF0I/AAAAAAAAg9Q/IhYeUYW48PA/s1600/fotolia_2469593_XS.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Arjuna leaves are used\nto cover ulcers &amp; sores externally, while leaf juice is used for curing\nearache (Otalgia). <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Arjuna bark powder &nbsp;metabolizes cellular energy<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-qjwKkDfmr54/UVA_zypsCnI/AAAAAAAAg88/Tv2pJFAaVmk/s1600/ugig.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; text-align: center;\">\n</div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n</div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The whole tree is so\nrich on calcium that even the soil it grows on becomes rich on this element too.\n&nbsp;The bark composition is 34% Calcium\nCarbonate. &nbsp;Calcium carbonate also is\nused as an antacid to relieve heartburn, acid indigestion, and upset stomach<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The powder of the bark\nis useful in cleaning teeth.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-ZiZol2ozViU/UVA_fAS-OsI/AAAAAAAAg8o/ZXVfGq477rc/s1600/Terminalia_arjuna_trunk_03_by_Line1.JPG\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">There is a 1000 year\nold Arjuna tree in the Melpattu tribal village in Jawadhu Hills the\ncircumference of the trunk of the tree alone is around 45 feet. This tree is\ncalled Neer Marithu in Malayalam.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The best way to use the\nbark is to pound it till it releases a butter juice. This juice can be mixed\nwith 2 teaspoonfuls of Amla juice and some honey and consumed regularly. &nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-QAso3jI-SfY/UVCU-D68h3I/AAAAAAAAg9I/q7zXfJV4bYE/s1600/arjuna+leaves.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"260\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-QAso3jI-SfY/UVCU-D68h3I/AAAAAAAAg9I/q7zXfJV4bYE/s320/arjuna+leaves.jpg\" width=\"320\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In about a litre of\nwater put 2 teaspoonfuls of splintered bark. &nbsp;Bring it to boil and then lower the flame to\nlet it simmer till the water becomes 500-600 ml (about half). &nbsp;Let it cool. &nbsp;Filter it. &nbsp;Drink about 200-250 ml in the morning and\nevening. &nbsp;You can prepare a larger\nquantity to store it for 2-3 days. &nbsp;&nbsp;Do NOT store it in plastic bottles.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-Ow2YPlAHhgo/UVA_QjzKAbI/AAAAAAAAg8g/GguF982bcd4/s1600/incrediblekumari3.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"246\" src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-Ow2YPlAHhgo/UVA_QjzKAbI/AAAAAAAAg8g/GguF982bcd4/s400/incrediblekumari3.jpg\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Its stem bark is\nantioxidant , anti-inflammatory, anti-pyretic, anti-bacterial ,\nanti-viral,&nbsp; anti-mutagenic and as an\nastringent. &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">No wonder Rig Veda praised\nthis tree 7000 years ago.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n</div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"line-height: 150%;\">India had the widest variety of organic medicinal herbs and\nplants on this planet. After the white Christian invader got their hands on our\nancient texts, they patented all this knowledge in their names.&nbsp;</span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://2.bp.blogspot.com/--g2dP86GZ9k/UVA_lOn6k6I/AAAAAAAAg8w/7pVlkczNf7s/s1600/imagesbigib.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"240\" src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/--g2dP86GZ9k/UVA_lOn6k6I/AAAAAAAAg8w/7pVlkczNf7s/s320/imagesbigib.jpg\" width=\"320\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\nCertain herbs\nwhich they could never procure outside India , they developed inorganic cures,\nwith side effects galore..&nbsp;</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\nToday in USA , the pharma lobby ensures that parents\nare slapped with criminal charges and jailed ( for child neglect ) if they do NOT use western allopathic medicines\non their own children . <o:p></o:p></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\nSo the big brother owned pharma lobby cares for your own\nchildren and loves them more than you .</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\nI am touched by such abundant -nay extravagant altruism , so I must cry.<o:p></o:p></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: large;\">Desi ghee is high in saturated fats like coconut oil- they are GOOD for health.. These two are the only good oils for cooking...never mind the kosher lies.</span></div>\n<br /><span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif;\">All plant oils aside from coconut oil are unsaturated. This means that they have double bonds in their molecular structures. Unsaturated oils are BAD for our health.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif;\">Hydrogenated oil, also called trans-fat or vanaspati, is added to food primarily because they have a very long shelf-life and don\u2019t melt easily..Hydrogenation makes oil less likely to spoil and makes the food look less greasy ..</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif;\">Hydrogenated oil, or trans-fat, is made by bubbling hydrogen through oil at a very high temperature. This turns the liquid oil into solid fat, creating chemical bonds which have similar structure to plastic.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif;\">AZIM PREMJI \u201cVanaspati \u201d , a very bad fat for health, was heavily promoted and widely used in India..The name itself is a complete lie \u2013&nbsp;</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif;\">Vanaspati ghee is NOT ghee. Wipro\u2019s Sunflower Vanaspati was sold as the \u201cnext best thing to pure ghee\u201d.. In reality Trans-fat is so toxic that even bacteria and microorganisms do not want to go near them.&nbsp;</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif;\">Trans-fats do not have any nutritional value.. On the other hand you can consume desi ghee and virgin coconut oils as much as you want..</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif;\">Like cigarettes, trans-fats have no safe level of consumption . Stay away from it completely..</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif;\">Most restaurants use vanaspati for cooking \u2013 it is very cheap and the food does not get spoiled for a long time. It is in your best interest to minimize eating out.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif;\">Due to the serious health condition that could result from trans-fats consumption, the United States Food and Drug Administration (FDA) have mandated that nutritional labeling should list trans-fat..</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif;\">Most US cities ( example-- New York ) have banned all artificial trans-fats from its restaurants</span><br /><div>\n<span style=\"color: blue; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: large;\"><br /></span></div>\n<span style=\"color: blue; font-size: large;\"><div style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif;\">\nWIPRO LIED ABOUT HOW HEALTHY THEIR VANASPATI IS..&nbsp;</div>\n<div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif;\"><br /></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif;\">THIS VANASPATI IS RESPONSIBLE FOR LAKHS OF HEART ATTACK/ STROKE DEATHS IN INDIA..&nbsp;</span></span><br /><span style=\"color: red; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2012/08/coconut-oil-is-good-for-cooking-ignore.html<br /><br />http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2013/03/arjuna-tree-virgin-coconut-oil-when.html</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif;\">WE KNOW THE DEEP STATE OLIGARCHS OR INDIA.. , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>There is no god.<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>There is no god at all.<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>He who created god was\na fool.<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>He who propagates god\nis a scoundrel.<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>He who worships god is\na barbarian</i>. ( so we have barbarians in Barani festival at Kodungallur , right)\n<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Even Periyar\u2019s last\nspeech, delivered in Chennai (Madras) on 19 December 1973, began exactly like\nthat. The speech has been printed by the Dravidar Kazhagam Publications, with\nthe title Periyar\u2019s Declaration of War on Brahminism. &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In this speech, Periyar has also enumerated\nthe main principles of the Self-Respect Movement:</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;<i>God must be\nabolished.<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>&nbsp;Religion must be\nabolished.</i><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">As an atheist, Periyar\nfirmly states that the belief in God or gods is \u201cdetrimental to the welfare of\nthe society.\u201d &nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">in 1953 in order to\ndiscourage idol-worship, Periyar led a statewide campaign to break the idols of\nGanesh at public places .&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">According to Periyar, it is important for the youth\nof India to know the injustice and cruelty embodied in the Manu's Code, so that\nthey can exert themselves to get rid of its evil influences. He ran down Manu,\nand gave propaganda the way the Christian invader wanted it, to do \u201cdivide and\nrule\u201d.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Just Google MANU\nWIKIPEDIA, and you can see that they are treating a young immature writer,\nAmish Tripati ( or Shiva Trilogy series ) as a learned historian. &nbsp;In these books he has converted Lord Shiva\ninto a sex starved mortal , and this makes big brother very happy.&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\nIf you wanna know who Manu is punch into Google search<b><span style=\"color: red;\"> MANU\n, THE FIRST LAW MAKER VADAKAYIL</span></b><o:p></o:p></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<b><span style=\"color: red;\"><br /></span></b></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In India for\na poor man God and family help him maintain his sanity, with HOPE.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">EV Ramasami Pariyar was\nburied and NOT cremated at Periyar Thidal on 25 December in a &nbsp;wooden coffin , with plenty of Christians in\nattendance .&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">He was NOT a Muslim, to be buried-- all know that. EVR Periyar had\ntold his people several times to convert to Christianity.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Now, who is\nKannaki who is throwing her anklets in the statue above ?--</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp; </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">who has been catapulted to\nKodungallur, by enemies of Hinduism ?</span></div>\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Before I get to\nKodungallur, let me go to the 6000 year old Managala Devi Temple of Thekkady, on top of the Western Ghats of Kerala.&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n</div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n</div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-KiHhBurwBos/UU1BoGo6aQI/AAAAAAAAgzQ/5D8_EdIoYdo/s1600/mangala-devi-temple-thekkady.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This\ntemple is dedicated to Goddess Parvati, wife of Lord Shiva.. This temple too is\nconsecrated by Lord Parashurama .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Mangalore\u2019s real name\nis &nbsp;Mangala Puram. &nbsp;&nbsp;There\nis an ancient temple dediated to Magaladevi there too. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The white Christian\ninvader has given away this Mangaladevi temple at Thekkady too, &nbsp;to our dear Kannaki.</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"color: red; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b>Below: This temple is so strongly built that you cannot destroy it by man power--you need explosives.</b></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n</div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">TEE HEEEE, I guess he has a\npoint there<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Beware of Tamilian lore\nprinted by the Christian missionaries press in Tamil. &nbsp;They are all fudged in a ridiculous manner and\ninjected with poison, to belittle Hinduism .<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-lG-3VomgiL0/UU1X8G-ZmmI/AAAAAAAAg0g/UXEJ1TACGE4/s1600/34935349.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This amazing rock temple at Thekkady with Kerala style architecture is situated high on the Western Ghats at a\nheight of 4500 feet , has an underground natural water filled tunnel all the\nway to Madurai Meenakshi temple.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This temple too\nwas destroyed by Tipu Sultan in search of gold .&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The clear water source\nof Meenakshi Temple Portramaraikulam tank , ( the temple with 1000 pillars ) is\nfrom this tunnel .&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Meenakshi temple tank is 165 by 120 ft and the same &nbsp;tunnel also is said to connect to the\nThirumalai Nayak Palace.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">From the peak of the\ntemple at Thekkady you can see several &nbsp;villages of Tamil Nadu on a clear day.&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n</div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-JCty9B27j70/UU1WnAUxCiI/AAAAAAAAg0Q/futPajv42Go/s1600/T_500_1032.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"448\" src=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-JCty9B27j70/UU1WnAUxCiI/AAAAAAAAg0Q/futPajv42Go/s400/T_500_1032.jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This\nforest mountain top temple is in the dense tiger infested reserve of Periyar.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-HMUJJJNop8s/UU1Az4p17dI/AAAAAAAAgy0/CAvF0ZHCL5o/s1600/kop.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"476\" src=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-HMUJJJNop8s/UU1Az4p17dI/AAAAAAAAgy0/CAvF0ZHCL5o/s400/kop.jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<br /></div>\n</div>\n<div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Ilamkovadigal's&nbsp; Tamil work is Silapathikaram,&nbsp; whose date of composition is uncertain , but\nis placed by the British as ninth century AD. &nbsp;In this book he tells a story. ( Very soon the\nstory of desh drohi Amish Tripati about Lord Shiva will be misused this away ).</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Kovalan was the son of\na merchant in Kaveripattinam, married Kannaki, a young woman . &nbsp;They lived together in the city of\nKaveripattinam, until Kovalan met the attractive dancer Madhavi and fell in\nlove with her. He neglected his wife Kannaki and soon squandered all his wealth\non the dancer. &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Pretty soon he became a\npauper, and Madhavi gave him the cold shoulder. &nbsp;Kovalan conveniently returned to Kannaki. &nbsp;Her only asset was a costly pair of anklets ( chilambu\u2014hence\nthe name of the epic ), &nbsp;encrusted with precious\nstones. &nbsp;Kannaki &nbsp;gave it to her husband so that he can have a\nfresh start as a merchant, using this as capital.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">They soon went to the\ngreat city of Madurai, where Kovalan hoped to recoup his fortunes by trade.&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">The city of Madurai was\nruled by the Pandya king Nedunj Cheliyan I. </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">His\nqueen lost her anklet, stolen by a courtier.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This anklet which\nKovilan was trying to sell in the market place looked very similar to the\nqueens lost anklet.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The only difference was\nthat Kannagi's were filled with rubies and the queen's filled with pearls, but\nthis was not a visible fact. &nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Kovilan was arrested\nand &nbsp;beheaded by the King's guards,\nwithout trial. When Kannaki was informed of this, she became furious, and set\nout to prove her husband's innocence to the king.&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Kannagi came to the\nking's court, </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">broke open the anklet\nseized from Kovalan and showed that it contained rubies, as opposed to the\nqueen's anklets which contained pearls. </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-xrBd9Pui8AM/UU1WXN7DrVI/AAAAAAAAg0I/EfEHnhaLSrY/s1600/ykt.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"320\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-xrBd9Pui8AM/UU1WXN7DrVI/AAAAAAAAg0I/EfEHnhaLSrY/s320/ykt.jpg\" width=\"318\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Realizing their fault, the King and the Queen\ndied of remorse. </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Unsatisfied, Kannagi\ntore out her left breast and flung it on the city, </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">uttering a curse that the entire city be burnt\n. </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Due to her utmost chastity, her curse\nbecame a reality.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The city was set ablaze\nresulting in huge human and economic losses. However, after the request from\nthe Goddess of the city, she withdrew her curse and later, attained salvation.\nThe story was narrated by the poet Ilango Adigal. An ironic, fact about this\nepic is that it portrays Madhavi, &nbsp;Kovalan's\nmistress , as an equally chaste woman. &nbsp;Manimekalai,\nanother ancient Tamil epic, is written in praise of Madhavi.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Kannaki is worshiped as\ngoddess Kannaki Amman by the Sri Lankan Tamil Hindus. &nbsp;She has been palmed off to Kerala using Christian\nmissionary printers as Kodungallur Bhagavathy \u2013where she is named Godess of\nsingle breast ( otta mulaichi )\u2014what a sick joke!<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A statue of Kannagi in\nanger holding her anklet in one hand demanding justice from the king, Pandiyan\non the death of her husband Kovalan , is an important landmark in Chennai, on\nthe famed Marina Beach, since 1968. text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-CFr00Q9sgNg/UU56lkAojvI/AAAAAAAAg2g/OoQWIDlaSYg/s1600/ndw.gif\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-CFr00Q9sgNg/UU56lkAojvI/AAAAAAAAg2g/OoQWIDlaSYg/s1600/ndw.gif\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Cancer doctors are you listening? &nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Why are you Darwin brainwashed guys on a wild goose\nchase? </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This is why when you punch in <b><span style=\"color: blue;\">DNA\nNASA</span></b> into Google search you will find my posts , cocking a snook at NASA protein\nscientists, on page 1 ahead of 51 million posts.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">AFTER Tipu Sultan\nlooted the temple , the temple was in dire straits financially. &nbsp;Those days the staunch temple vaults were used\nas a bank locker to keep gold.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">To add to their woes, the mosque and church were\nluring Hindus away.&nbsp; &nbsp;A lot of low caste Hindus became Muslims so\nthat they can get the left over estates of the high caste Hindus who dies in\nbattle with Tipu Sultan. &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Church as usual\nwas spreading lies about Hinduism and luring converts with lollipops and sops. &nbsp;Namboodiri excesses in Kerala where they could\nwalk in into any house and do Sambandham ( screw the female there ) did not\nhelp matters.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This forced the temple authorities to throw the temple open for\neverybody for 27 days in a year. This caused an invasion of vulgar disruptive\nforces, egged on by enemies of Hinduism .&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The desecrated temple was then shut down for a week for cleaning and\npurification rites to remove the stain of pollution . &nbsp;Desecration was NOT by ribald songs alone, but\nthey low caste devotees threw stones and bags of turmeric , bleeding chicken etc\nover the roof into the inner sanctum.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; line-height: 150%; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-hFJjicfkXkY/UU6LW1vGnHI/AAAAAAAAg4w/pwRKmzCKbes/s1600/bhagavathy_image.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"400\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-hFJjicfkXkY/UU6LW1vGnHI/AAAAAAAAg4w/pwRKmzCKbes/s400/bhagavathy_image.jpg\" width=\"357\" /></a></div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<span style=\"color: magenta; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;;\"><b><span style=\"font-size: small;\"><span style=\"line-height: 150%;\">Above: The idol of Bhagavati devi ( Kodungallur amma ) in Kodungallur temple is 6 feet tall and made of a&nbsp;</span></span><span style=\"line-height: 24px;\">trunk</span><span style=\"font-size: small;\"><span style=\"line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;of jack fruit tree.</span></span></b></span><br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This is a&nbsp; Shiva temple originally, as worship is\noffered first to Shiva before being offered to Bhagawati, and there is a\nmandapam in front of the shiva shrine, while there is &nbsp;none in front of Bhagawati\u2019s. Shiva created\nKaali and she killed demon Daaruka. &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">As part\nof Bharani festival, on Aswathi day, the ritual performed in the noon is called\nTrichandana Pooja. &nbsp;This is considered as\nthe most powerful ritual of this temple and is done by Adigas from Karnataka ,\nas a ritual started by Adi Shankaracharya in 2000 BC, after he came to Kerala\nfrom Mookambika temple at Kollur.&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-mkCuf4MX0CQ/UU6N75siTSI/AAAAAAAAg44/GvKgagb_r1c/s1600/jjj.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"357\" src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-mkCuf4MX0CQ/UU6N75siTSI/AAAAAAAAg44/GvKgagb_r1c/s400/jjj.jpg\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">He had failed to bring the Devi to Kondungallur as he looked back, on the way from Kudajadri mountain at her when her anklet jingles stopped, breaking a vow.&nbsp;&nbsp;Adigas are the\nequivalent of Namboodiris in Karnataka..<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-L_j1z3maVhA/UU6PW4QjhKI/AAAAAAAAg5A/pTCRSGKCtY8/s1600/ssc.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"320\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-L_j1z3maVhA/UU6PW4QjhKI/AAAAAAAAg5A/pTCRSGKCtY8/s400/ssc.jpg\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">After India became\nIndependent the local kings went out of the limelight. The new generation did\nNOT know who the king was nor cared. &nbsp;He\ncould be in a crowded market place and nobody knew or cared. On top of that\nthey lost their privy purses.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Kodingallur Bharani festival was used by the King\nto be in the limelight. &nbsp;He still visits\nfor his brief few minutes of glory. The days function starts with the King ,\n\u201cKodungalloor Valiya Thamburan\u201d &nbsp;comes in\nthe palanquin carried by people in kingly style.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; line-height: 150%; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-qjaUITdXAQI/UU6HvkVg1cI/AAAAAAAAg3w/ObaJ0ImyNk4/s1600/ggg.JPG\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"226\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-qjaUITdXAQI/UU6HvkVg1cI/AAAAAAAAg3w/ObaJ0ImyNk4/s320/ggg.JPG\" width=\"320\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Pretty soon His Highness gives\npermission for People to enter the Kavu. The signal is given by raising the\ndecorated umbrella known as \u201cChuvanna Pattu Kuda\u201d. &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; line-height: 150%; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-hHIdvW3FiEY/UU6H1g5bJWI/AAAAAAAAg34/9bO5VVq1rys/s1600/109.JPG\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"300\" src=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-hHIdvW3FiEY/UU6H1g5bJWI/AAAAAAAAg34/9bO5VVq1rys/s400/109.JPG\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Once royal permission is obtained, the\n\u201cKomarams\u201d &nbsp;or oracles\u201d will run around\nthe temple 3 times, in great gusto &nbsp;holding\ntheir swords and beating the temple roof with the bamboo sticks. &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; line-height: 150%; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-RF3zECiCdTc/UU6H9bPyc8I/AAAAAAAAg4A/-pKyqjudCxA/s1600/yyy.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"227\" src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-RF3zECiCdTc/UU6H9bPyc8I/AAAAAAAAg4A/-pKyqjudCxA/s320/yyy.jpg\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">They throw objects inside the temple mainly\nsticks which signifies the Kavutheendal, and then fall at the feet of the&nbsp; king of the area seeking his blessing\u2014this is\nwhat he is waiting for. &nbsp;It could be said\nthat the presence of the king and his guards as witnesses prevents a riot and destruction of\nthe temple.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; line-height: 150%; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-1-sw3n_d9gY/UU6IMU5tP1I/AAAAAAAAg4I/OZwExHuxQaw/s1600/Kodungallur_Bhagavathy_Temple_003.JPG\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"432\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-1-sw3n_d9gY/UU6IMU5tP1I/AAAAAAAAg4I/OZwExHuxQaw/s400/Kodungallur_Bhagavathy_Temple_003.JPG\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The oracles sing\nnumerous songs that are associated with the legend of the Goddess and those\nassociated with farming, culture and mother earth.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Once the \u201cKavu\ntheendal\u201d is over, The umbrella will be folded and His Highness will leave for\nhis palace, now awaiting the next year , for his few minutes of glory.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-6QWSAf4e17o/UU8U7RK12ZI/AAAAAAAAg5Y/8SXG4DqxIoU/s1600/kodungallor+bharani+2.JPG\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"640\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-6QWSAf4e17o/UU8U7RK12ZI/AAAAAAAAg5Y/8SXG4DqxIoU/s640/kodungallor+bharani+2.JPG\" width=\"322\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Kodungallur temple\nhas an image of being a great social leveller. &nbsp;Its doors were open to those at the bottom of\nthe caste hierarchy long before the official temple entry legislation came into\nforce. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The supreme court has\nbanned vulgar songs in Kodungallur during the festival. &nbsp;Decent folks in the\nvicinity of the temple with young teenager daughters , were forced to keep\ntheir windows shut. &nbsp;Local bus conductors warn young women NOT to get into a bus\nwhere vulgar songs are being sung .&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-U03MsF4G89w/UU6Re316jDI/AAAAAAAAg5I/mulsvHJiA8s/s1600/eee.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"640\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-U03MsF4G89w/UU6Re316jDI/AAAAAAAAg5I/mulsvHJiA8s/s640/eee.jpg\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n</div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">With the internet age , these songs are\ngetting more and more graphic . &nbsp;This has\nturned into a sort of ragging or hazing in Kerala colleges and hostels which can get very traumatic for girls from good families.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: small;\">It is high time this Hinduism\ndesecrating nonsense ( </span><span style=\"background-color: yellow;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><b><span style=\"color: red;\">VULGAR SONGS ONLY</span></b> </span></span><span style=\"font-size: small;\">) is stopped.<o:p></o:p></span></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Amarakosha is a\nthesaurus of Sanskrit written by the Jain scholar Amarasimha who belonged to 8<sup>th</sup>\ncentury AD.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\">As per the Christian\nwhite historian, Adi Shankaracharya saved Amarakosha from a fire.<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\">So we are supposed to believe\nthat Adi Shankaracharya was indeed a recent phenomen \u2013 &nbsp;thrown back in time by 3800 years.. &nbsp;&nbsp;Like\nhow Lord Ayyapa had conversations with a Muslim.<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\">Mahavira was born after Buddha &nbsp;as per the white historian . &nbsp;In my opinion Mahavira was born a couple of thousand years before Buddha.. &nbsp;Adi Shankaracharya was born before Buddha in 2000 BC. They are indeed the same, just as musk and its scent are inseparable, or as fire and its heat are nondifferent. And all Oriya Puri party got pissed off.<br />\n<br />\nThe Italian waitress release stamps of the FAKE jayadeva in 2009. mention Krishna , but NEVER EVER a woman named Radha.<br />\n<br />\nDuring British Rule all Krishna temples idols were roved to insert Radha as a jodi.<br />\n<br />\nThe FAKE Geeta-Govinda was full of immoral sex and erotica to describe the ILLICIT love between \"Radha\" and a married Krishna.<br />\n<br />\nFoul and explicit SEXUAL passages were deleted by Jew Rothschild when original Hindu SORRY, SHIVA IS A COMIC ALLEGORY<br />\n<br />\nNOW HE GIVES HAJJAR BULL ABOUT HEAVEN, HELL AND CHITRAGUPTA..<br />\n<br />\nSORRY --THERE IS NO HEAVEN AND HELL IN HINDUISM.. WE NEVER HEARD OF CHITRAGUPTA ( AND MISSING LINK KAYASTHAS ) TILL THE WHITE INVADER CAME TO INDIA..<br />\n<br />\nIN SANATANA DHARMA HEAVEN IS THE SEVENTH ASTRAL LAYER ( BRAHMAN THE FIELD ) WHO SHEARED OFF A SMALL BIT OF HIS BODY AND SEND YOU AS A SOUL ( BALL OF ENERGY ) AT ITS LOWEST FREQUENCY TO GAIN LIFE EXPERIENCE..<br />\n<br />\nYOU ( YOUR SOUL EVOLVED ) FROM BACTERIA, TO BIRD, TO ANIMAL TO HUMAN WITH LOW FREQUENCY SOULD TO MOKSHA SOUL OF HIGHEST FREQUENCY , SAME AS BRAHMAN --AFTER WHICH YOUR SOUL MERGED BACK WITH MOTHER FIELD OF BRAHMAN TO SHARE LIFE EXPERIENCES WITH ITS MOTHER ..<br />\n<br />\nWHEN THE FEED BACK STOPS IN THIS CLOSED LOOP --PRALAYA ( DISSOLUTION ) HAPPENS ..<br />\n<br />\nFIRST ASTRAL LATER IS MEANT FOR ALL SPECIES OF LIVES --EXCEPT HUMAN .. THE SOULS OF CRIMINALS/ HOMOSEXUALS WHO HAVE NO CONSCIENCE ARE IN THE LAYER..<br />\n<br />\nSECOND TO SIXTH LAYERS ARE MEANT ONLY FOR CONSCIOUS HUMANS..<br />\n<br />\nTHE SECOND ASTRAL LAYER MEANT FOR SOULS WITH LOWEST FREQUENCY ( HIGH NEGATIVE KARMIC BAGGAGE ) AND THE SIXTH ASTRAL HAVING PARKING SPACE FOR SOULS OF HIGHER FREQUENCY ( LOW NEGATIVE KARMIC BAGGAGE ).<br />\n<br />\nYAMA IS IN CHARGE OF LAYERS TWO TO SIX..<br />\n<br />\nALL SOULS IN FIRST TO SIXTH ASTRAL LAYERS --AWAIT RE-BIRTH.<br />\n<br />\nSEVENTH ASTRAL LAYER IS THE FIELD OF BRAHMAN ( VAIKUNTA ).. HERE ONLY MOKSHA SOULS -- NIL EGO, NIL KRAMIC BAGGAGE AND HIGHEST SOULD FREQUENCY ( SAME AS MOTHER FIELD BRAHMAN ) CAN ENTER --TO BE MERGED WITH BRAHMAN ( GOD )..<br />\n<br />\nONLY SOULS CAN ENTER ALL SEVEN ASTRAL LAYERS --NOT THE PHYSICAL BODY ..<br />\n<br />\nTHE RASCAL SADUGU JAGGI VASUDEV LIES ABOUT PLENTY FOOD TO EAT AND APSARAS FOR SEX IN SEVENTH LAYER .. BALLS !<br />\n<br />\nWHEN THE 5 PANDAVA BROTHERS AND DRAUPADI DECIDE TO CLIMB MOUNT MERU --IT IS AN ALLEGORY FOR DEATH AND SOULS PARKING AT ONE OF THE SEVEN ASTRAL LAYERS<br />\n<br />\nYAMA ( DHARMA ) IN THE FORM OF A DOG JOINS THIS GROUP ..<br />\n<br />\nYAMA USHERS IN --<br />\nDRAUPADI INTO THE SECOND ASTRAL LAYER<br />\nNAKULA INTO THE THIRD ASTRAL LAYER<br />\nSAHADEVA INTO THE FOURTH ASTRAL LAYER<br />\nBHIMA INTO THE FIFTH ASTRAL LAYER<br />\nARJUNA INTO THE SIXTH ASTRAL LAYER<br />\n<br />\nAND THEN YUDHISTRA LOOKS BACK AND SEES THE DOG.. HE KNOWS THAT NO DOG CAN GET PAST THE FIRST ASTRAL LAYER --AND HE IS PUZZLED..<br />\n<br />\nAT THE SEVENT ASTRAL LAYER ( EQUIVALENT OF HEAVEN ) YUDDHISTRA SEES ALL HUNDRED KAURAVAS ALREADY THERE -- ALONG WITH THE STALWARTS LIKE BHISHMA/ DRONA /KARNA ETC<br />\n<br />\nHE IS SHOCKED AND ANGRY<br />\n<br />\nAT THAT TIME YAMA ( THE DOORKEEPER OF ASTRAL LAYERS 2 TO 6 ) DECLARES THAT HE IS YUDDHISTRAs FATHER WITH KUNTI .. AND THAT YUDDHISTRA STILL HAS SEEDS OF EGO WITHIN HIMS WHICH MAKES HIM UNFIT FOR MOKSHA ..<br />\n<br />\nYAMAs EXPLANATION: WHOEVER KRISHNA KILLED --ALL GOT MOKSHA .. KRISHNA HAD THE UNWRITTEN TASK OF KILLING ALL 100 TEST TUBE KAURAVA BABIES-- HE DID IT AND HOW..<br />\n<br />\nPANDAVAS WOULD HAVE HAD ALBINO BLOOD OF MOTHER KUNTI HAS SEX WITH PANDU ( AN ALBINO )--AND IN THAT CASE KRISHNA WOULD HAVE KILLED ALL 5 PANDAVAS TOO..<br />\n<br />\nBeautiful and intelligent Queen Kunti was the mother of Karna and the first three Pandava brothers Yudhishthira, Bhima, Arjuna. .<br />\n<br />\nCONTINUED TO 2--</div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"comment-replies\" id=\"bc_0_179BR\" style=\"margin-left: 36px; WHICH WAS OWNED BY THE CALICUT KING ( MY HOMETOWN)..<br /><br />Manu wrote 10,300 years ago --\u201c All the people on earth should learn their respective practices from a Brahmin born in that land of Brahmarisihidesa \u201d..<br /><br />JUST BECAUSE VEDAS WERE WRITTEN 7000 YEARS AGO--IT DOES NOT MEAN THERE WERE NO TEXTS BEFORE THAT..<br /><br />THIS IS BECAUSE ARYAVARTA ( PUNT/ SHEBA / OPHIR/ MALABAR/ ARYAVARTA / LAND OF GODS / BRAHMARISHIDESA ) WAS PART OF THE DANAVA CIVILIZATION-WHICH PRECEDED THE VEDIC CIVILISATION BY SEVERAL MILLINIUMS..<br /><br /><span style=\"color: red;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2017/05/land-of-punt-ophir-and-sheba-is-north.html</span><br /><br />Brahmavarta area is credited to be Abode of Gods and was described as a land filled with Aryans.. Aryans were the Sanskrit and Veda oral route knowing cream of the Thiyyas of Kerala..<br /><br />Manusmriti records \u201c Those who were born in this holy land Aryavarta , were purer of all, the purity reduces as they move away from this place\u201d<br /><br />ATYAVARTA ( MALABAR ) IS THE LAND OF ARYANS.. THE WHITE INVADER WAS EFFICIENT IN DELETING THIS .. ARYANS BECAME THE WHITE SKINNED , BLONDE, BLUE EYED MEN FROM EUROPE WHO CREATED SANSKRIT AND WROTE OUR VEDAS..<br /><br />AND ROTHSCHILD HAS A CHITPAVAN JEW NAMED LOK MANYA BAL GANGHADARA TILAK CEMENTING IT WITH HIS LYING BOOK \" ARCTIC HOME OF THE VEDAS \"..<br /><br />Sage Vyasa founded a vast FOREST UNIVERSITY which came to be known as Brahmarshidesha..<br /><br />This was the forest where the BRAHMANAS ( part 2 ) and ARANYAKAS ( part 3) of VEDAS were created . These two parts written in Sanskrit and Grantha lipi ( techinical volumes ) have been stolen by the white invader..<br /><br />Vyasa himself lived in Brahmavarta to spread learning and increase his own spiritual knowledge from the 12 strand DNA supermen who lived there. He was assisted by son Shuka with his four disciples, Srimantu, Jaimini, Paila and Vaishampayana..<br /><br />ARYAVARTA IS THE CRADLE OF THIS PLANETs KNOWLEDGE ..<br /><br /><span style=\"color: red;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2016/10/eight-sided-pyramid-of-giza-egypt.html</span><br /><br />TODAY THE FOUNTAINHEAD OF ARYAVARTA WHERE ANCIENT GREEKS GRADUATED HAS BECOME A VIRTUAL WHOREHOUSE..<br /><br /><span style=\"color: red;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2013/03/kodungallur-bharani-festival-capt-ajit.html</span><br /><br />JEW ROTHSCHILD GAVE THE BULL THAT KANNAKI ( TAMIL PRIDE HEROINE OF SILAPATHIKARAM ) IS IN ONE OF THE UNDERGROUND VAULTS.. IN REALITY HE WAS SEARCHING FOR HIS ARK OF THE COVENENT..<br /><br />Brahmarshi-Desha or Aryavarta, is a model region of discipline and order, and that \"from a Brahman born in that region, all men on earth should receive their lessons in their respective duties and responsibilities.\" (MBh. XIV, 110.47).<br /><br />Indeed , The Law Code of Manu in Chapter 2, verse 17, says, \"That land of Bharat , created by the gods, lies between the divine river Sarasvati and divine land Brahmavarta.<br /><br />The Law Code of Manu mentions the Rig Veda many times, but the Rig Veda did not mention the Law Code of Manu even once.<br /><br />This is because Rig Veda went of oral route for 330 centuries before being penned down 70 centuries ago.. Manu made his laws 10,300 years ago.<br /><br />The Law Code of Manu does not just mention the Rig Veda only in passing, but as the cornerstone of its civilization's philosophical and spiritual thought.<br /><br />HAMMURABI LIFTED HIS LAWS WHOLE SALE FROM THE LAWS OF MANU ..<br /><br />BEING A SHIP CAPTAIN IN KNOW THE MODERN MARITIME LAW OF \"BOTTOMRY\"..<br /><br />IT IS AMAZING THAT THIS LAW IS A DIRECT LIFT FROM THE LAWS OF MANU..<br /><br />CONTINUED TO 2--</div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"comment-replies\" style=\"margin-left: 36px; margin-top: 1em;\">\n<div class=\"comment-thread inline-thread\" id=\"c9221734683551707522-rt\" style=\"background-color: #eeeeee; margin: 8px 0px; padding: 0.5em 1em;\">\n<ol class=\"thread-chrome thread-expanded\" id=\"c9221734683551707522-ra\" style=\"list-style-type: none; padding: 0px;\">\n<li class=\"comment\" id=\"c4227901023722165533\" style=\"border-bottom: 0px; margin: 0px 0px 16px; padding: 16px 0px 0px;\"><div class=\"avatar-image-container\" style=\"float: left; font-size: 16px; margin: 0.2em 0px 0px; max-height: 36px; overflow: hidden; width: 36px;\">\n</div>\n<div class=\"comment-block\" style=\"margin-left: 48px; position: relative;\">\n<div class=\"comment-header\" style=\"font-size: 16px; margin: 0px 0px 8px;\">\n<cite class=\"user\" style=\"font-style: normal; font-weight: bold;\"><a href=\"https://www.blogger.com/profile/14410812789424637654\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration-line: none;\">Capt. Ajit Vadakayil</a></cite><span class=\"icon user blog-author\" style=\"background-image: url(&quot;data:image/png; background-repeat: no-repeat; display: inline-block; font-weight: bold; height: 18px; margin: 0px 0px -4px 6px; width: 18px;\"></span><span class=\"datetime secondary-text\" style=\"margin-left: 6px;\"><a href=\"https://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2019/02/mistakes-deliberate-or-inadvertant-in.html?showComment=1549200842429#c4227901023722165533\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration-line: none;\">February 3, 2019 at 7:04 PM</a></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-content\" style=\"margin-bottom: 8px; text-align: justify;\">\nCONTINUED FROM 1--<br /><br /><span style=\"color: red;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2011/01/manu-first-law-maker-capt-ajit.html</span><br /><br />Sir William Jones wrote that the Hindus of Kerala must have been navigators in the age of the writing of the Law Code of Manu, because the Law Code of Manu mentions bottomry (The lending of money for marine insurance).<br /><br />A bottomry, or bottomage, is an arrangement in which the master of a ship borrows money upon the bottom or keel of it, so as to forfeit the ship itself to the creditor, if the money with interest is not paid at the time appointed at the ship's safe return.<br /><br />This occurs, for example, where the ship needs urgent repairs during the course of its voyage or some other emergency arises and it is not possible for the master ( ship captain ) to contact the owner to arrange funds, allowing the master to borrow money on the security of the ship or the cargo by executing a bond. Where the ship is hypothecated, the bond is called a bottomry bond.<br /><br />The Code of Hammurabi describes a form of bottomry which is a risk transferring technique. A bottomry would be taken, but the repayment would be contingent on the ship successfully completing the voyage. This is more like a catastrophe bond than traditional insurance. In traditional insurance, you pay premiums and receive a benefit on the risk event. With bottomry and catastrophe bonds, you receive a loan up front and only pay it back with a premium if the risk event doesn't occur.<br /><br />CHANAKYA , THE ARYAN , HAD WRITTEN ABOUT SHIPPING LAWS AND MARINE INSURANCE LAWS IN HIS ARTHASHASTRA..<br /><br />my revelations now come to&nbsp;<span style=\"color: red; font-size: large;\"><b>59.38%</b></span><br /><br />When it reaches 97% the COLLECTIVE TWATS AND BALLS of this planet will go TRRRRRRRRRRRRR in resonance ..<br /><br />capt ajit vadakayil<br />..</div>\n</div>\n</li>\n<li class=\"comment\" id=\"c4227901023722165533\" style=\"border-bottom: 0px; margin: 0px 0px 16px; padding: 16px 0px 0px;\"><div>\n<br /></div>\n</li>\n</ol>\n</div>\n</div>\n</li>\n</ol>\n<span style=\"background-color: orange; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"></span>\n<span style=\"background-color: orange; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"background-color: orange; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Harshil Shah<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: orange; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">September 21, 2014 at\n9:06 AM<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: orange; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Pranam Guruji,<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: orange; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Indeed, i read the\nabove post and its exactly same.
